II. Purpose of Addendum
The agency requested approval for use of existing space in the facility that was
previously utilized for a Day Treatment Program. The Day Treatment Program has
been moved to another location and the agency wishes to use this space for waking
hours programming for the secure residential treatment program youth.
III. Methodology
07/23/14 Contact-Document Sent
Emails exchanged with Lisa Greco, Director, regarding use of existing
additional facility space for daytime programming for secure residential
treatment program.

IV. Description of Findings and Conclusions
The existing space in the facility includes a sizable dayroom with several tables and
two computer terminals for school work completion, a classroom, therapy/visitation
rooms, meeting rooms, staff offices, program/multi-use room, storage closets,
restrooms, lockers, and a kitchen. All of these areas are staff secured and most are
included in the facility’s electronic monitoring and security system. There are 15
new cameras in this area and all are tied to the control center, as are the locked
2

doors. There is also an outdoor courtyard off of the day room. The courtyard does
have an 8 foot cement wall but it could be scaled. The agency reports that the youth
will be staff secured when in this area and precautions will be taken to ensure youth
do not escape.
The court has granted standing day passes for the girls treatment program,
however, the agency was advised that in the event a youth does escape from the
courtyard, notification procedures will need to be followed as they pertain to escape
from a secured facility.
The residential youth will be escorted to this area of the building for waking hours
and transition back to the original area for sleeping hours. Breakfast, then school,
lunch, therapy groups, service work, leisure activities, dinner, chores, group, and
leisure time will all be conducted in the new area. The kitchen area will be for
serving prepared meals and not used for cooking. The commercial kitchen in the
original section will prepare meals and they will be brought to this kitchen and
served.
V. Recommendation
I recommend approval for use of the new space as part of the secure residential
treatment program.
